instruction: Move the slider to change the orientation of the light source and observe the change in shadow cast by the same object.

options.feedback: Light is blocked by the object's surface facing it, which casts a circular shadow on the screen.
Light is blocked by the object's surface facing it, which casts a rectangular shadow on the screen.

question: Identify the shadow when light is projected on this object from the top.
solution:
• Opaque Objects cast shadow when light falls on them.
 • The circular top of the object is blocking the light falling on top of it, hence it casts a circular shadow.
summary: You have successfully learned that an object can cast different shadows by changing the orientation of a light source.
